citations.narrative:
The facility has 20 domestic cats but the acquisition information for only 1 cat is recorded on APHIS Form 7005 (Record
of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand). APHIS Form 7005 must be used in order to ensure all required acquisition
information is documented and available for the APHIS inspector.
Each dealer shall use APHIS Form 7005 to make, keep, and maintain required acquisition information. The licensee must
add the acquisition information for the remaining 19 domestic cats to APHIS Form 7005 and ensure that the form is kept
updated and available for inspection.
Correction date: November 21, 2025
The facility has not been using APHIS Form 7006 (Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats) to document the sale of the
kittens. APHIS Form 7006 must be used in order to ensure that all required disposition information is documented and
available for inspection.
Each dealer shall use APHIS Form 7006 (Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats) to make, keep, and maintain the
required disposition information. The licensee must use APHIS Form 7006 to record the disposition (sale, donation, or
trade) of all adult cats and kittens and ensure these records are available for inspection.
Correction date: November 14, 2025

There are 5 bags of unopened cat food stored on the floor of the housing facility. Bags of food stored directly on the floor
could become spoiled or contaminated should they come into contact with spilled water. Bags stored on the floor can also
interfere with cleaning of the facility which could attract pests such as insects and rodents.
Unopened bags of food must be stored off the floor and away from walls to allow for cleaning and to protect the food from
contamination and spoilage. The licensee must store the 5 bags of food off the floor and ensure that all unopened bags of
food are stored compliantly at all times.
Correction date: November 21, 2025
At least 4 open bags of cat food were found in the housing facility. Open bags of food could become contaminated by
pests such as insects or rodents.
Open bags of food must be stored in a leakproof container with a tightly fitting lid to protect the food from contamination.
The licensee must place the 4 bags of opened food into containers with tightly fitting lids and ensure all open bags of food
are stored compliantly at all times.
Correction date: November 21, 2025

At least 3 trash cans in the housing facility do not have lids. Open trash cans could attract pests such as insects and
rodents which could have a negative impact on the health of the cats.
Trash containers in housing facilities and food storage and preparation areas must be leakproof and have tightly fitted
lids. The licensee must add tightly fitting lids to each trash can and ensure they remain on the cans at all times.
Correction date: November 21, 2025

One enclosure, containing 1 adult cat and 3 kittens, does not have an elevated resting surface. Elevated resting surfaces
allow a cat to exhibit its normal behaviors of jumping and/or climbing and permits a cat space to move away from other
cats.
Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain an elevated resting surface. The licensee must add an elevated
resting surface to the enclosure and ensure each enclosure contains a compliant elevated resting surface(s) at all times.
Correction date: November 21, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility has 20 domestic cats but the acquisition information for only 1 cat is recorded on APHIS Form 7005 (Record 
of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand). APHIS Form 7005 must be used in order to ensure all required acquisition 
information is documented and available for the APHIS inspector. 
 
Each dealer shall use APHIS Form 7005 to make, keep, and maintain required acquisition information. The licensee must 
add the acquisition information for the remaining 19 domestic cats to APHIS Form 7005 and ensure that the form is kept 
updated and available for inspection. 
 
Correction date: November 21, 2025 
 
The facility has not been using APHIS Form 7006 (Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats) to document the sale of the 
kittens. APHIS Form 7006 must be used in order to ensure that all required disposition information is documented and 
available for inspection. 
 
Each dealer shall use APHIS Form 7006 (Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats) to make, keep, and maintain the 
required disposition information. The licensee must use APHIS Form 7006 to record the disposition (sale, donation, or 
trade) of all adult cats and kittens and ensure these records are available for inspection. 
 
Correction date: November 14, 2025 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There are 5 bags of unopened cat food stored on the floor of the housing facility. Bags of food stored directly on the floor 
could become spoiled or contaminated should they come into contact with spilled water. Bags stored on the floor can also 
interfere with cleaning of the facility which could attract pests such as insects and rodents. 
 
Unopened bags of food must be stored off the floor and away from walls to allow for cleaning and to protect the food from 
contamination and spoilage. The licensee must store the 5 bags of food off the floor and ensure that all unopened bags of

food are stored compliantly at all times. 
 
Correction date: November 21, 2025 
 
At least 4 open bags of cat food were found in the housing facility. Open bags of food could become contaminated by 
pests such as insects or rodents.  
 
Open bags of food must be stored in a leakproof container with a tightly fitting lid to protect the food from contamination. 
The licensee must place the 4 bags of opened food into containers with tightly fitting lids and ensure all open bags of food 
are stored compliantly at all times. 
 
Correction date: November 21, 2025 
3.1(f) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
At least 3 trash cans in the housing facility do not have lids. Open trash cans could attract pests such as insects and 
rodents which could have a negative impact on the health of the cats. 
 
Trash containers in housing facilities and food storage and preparation areas must be leakproof and have tightly fitted 
lids. The licensee must add tightly fitting lids to each trash can and ensure they remain on the cans at all times.  
 
Correction date: November 21, 2025 
3.6(b)(4) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
One enclosure, containing 1 adult cat and 3 kittens, does not have an elevated resting surface. Elevated resting surfaces 
allow a cat to exhibit its normal behaviors of jumping and/or climbing and permits a cat space to move away from other 
cats. 
 
Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain an elevated resting surface. The licensee must add an elevated 
resting surface to the enclosure and ensure each enclosure contains a compliant elevated resting surface(s) at all times. 
 
Correction date: November 21, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
